Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration agent properly assessed the applicant's eligibility under the Federal Skilled Worker class
Evidence_Type: Evidence of duties performed as per NOC
Legal_Provision: Subsection 75(2) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Applicant failed to meet occupational requirements due to insufficient evidence
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of reasoning in agent's decision
Regulation_Cited: Subsection 75(2), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Application_Factor: Performance of tasks described in NOC occupational descriptions and a substantial number of main duties
Decision_Outcome: Applicant deemed ineligible for permanent residence
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable decision due to lack of explanation and improper evidence use
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Subsection 75(2), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Outcome_of_Review: Decision annulled, case remanded for reevaluation
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of meeting occupational requirements
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of decision and use of improper evidence
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, Subsection 75(2)
Procedural_Issue: Lack of transparent and justifiable decision-making process
